description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Add JIT file sessions plus batch sync APIs to improve remote markdown workflows and Obsidian-style local mirror behavior.
- Add desktop font zoom shortcuts and whole-webview zoom support for better readability.
Fixes & polish
- Tighten session execution timeline spacing and hide synthetic control-only transcript parts.
- Auto-scroll live thinking updates and prevent stale localStorage base URL restores in Tauri mode.
- Gate workspace recover action and make recovery non-blocking.
Packaging / ops
- Bump all packages to v0.11.128 and refresh AUR metadata.
Compare:
